conclusion: Consider how the position and size of the shadows will change when the light source moves to the right above the objects.
The shadows are currently cast to the left of the objects due to the light source being on the left side.
When the light source moves to the right, the direction of the light rays changes, affecting the position and size of the shadows.
As the light source moves to the right, the shadows will shift to the left because the light rays will now be coming from the right.
The size of the shadows will change; when the light source is directly above the objects, the shadows will be smaller due to more perpendicular light rays.
As the light source moves to the right, the angle of the light rays increases, causing the shadows to elongate and become larger.
The shadows will move to the left and become larger as the light source moves to the right above the objects.
